intro: Cussonia quarrei, commonly known as the African bristleleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Araceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in diameter. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Cussonia quarrei is valued for its ornamental foliage and is sometimes cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens.
